member.name: T:System.Windows.Navigation.FragmentNavigationEventArgs
member.summary: FragmentNavigationEventArgs exposes the fragment being navigated to in an event fired from NavigationService to notify a listening client that a navigation to fragment is about to occur.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.FragmentNavigationEventArgs.Fragment
member.summary: The fragment part of the URI that was passed to the Navigate() API which initiated this navigation. The fragment may be String.Empty to indicate a scroll to the top of the page.

member.summary: This will check for deep link values in the URL if the Frame's IJournal is integrated with the browser.
member.returns: A value indicating whether or not deep links were found.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.StopLoading
member.summary: StopLoading aborts asynchronous navigations that haven't been processed yet. The Stopped event is fired only if the navigation was aborted.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.GoBack
member.summary: Navigates the Frame to the previous journal entry in the history stack.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.GoForward
member.summary: Navigates the Frame to the next journal entry in the history stack.

member.summary: Occurs when the an exception is raised during navigation.

member.name: E:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.NavigationStopped
member.summary: Occurs when a navigation operation has been cancelled.

member.name: E:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.FragmentNavigation
member.summary: Occurs when a navigation occurs within a page

member.name: P:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the Uri of the content currently hosted in the Frame.
member.remarks: This value may be different from CurrentSource if you set Source and the navigation has not yet completed. CurrentSource reflects the page currently in the frame at all times, even when an async loading operation is in progress.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.JournalOwnership
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if this owns its own journal, or attempts to integrate with the browser journal. See for a description of the options.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.CanGoBack
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the Frame can navigate backward.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.CanGoForward
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the Frame can navigate forward.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.CurrentSource
member.summary: Gets the Uri of the content currently hosted in the Frame.
member.remarks: This value may be different from Source if you set Source and the navigation has not yet completed. CurrentSource reflects the page currently in the frame at all times, even when an async loading operation is in progress.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Controls.Page
member.summary: Represents a piece of navigable content

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.Page.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a default Page instance

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.Page.OnFragmentNavigation(System.Windows.Navigation.FragmentNavigationEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called when fragment navigation occurs on a page - either because a fragment was present in the original Uri that navigated to this page, or because a later fragment navigation occurs.
member.remarks: This should be used rather than signing up for this.NavigationService.FragmentNavigation because that event may be difficult to sign up for in time to get the first fragment navigation.
member.param: The event arguments, containing the fragment navigated to

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.Page.OnNavigatedTo(System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called when a Page has been navigated to, and becomes the active Page in a Frame. This method is the preferred place to inspect this.NavigationContext, and react to load-time information and prepare the page for viewing.
member.remarks: This should be used rather than Loaded because Loaded signifies you have been added to the visual tree, but that could potentially happen more than once during a logical navigation event, in some advanced scenarios. This method is guaranteed to be called only once when the Page becomes active.
member.param: The event arguments

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.Page.OnNavigatingFrom(System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called when a Page is about to be navigated away from.
member.remarks: This is similar to signing up for this.NavigationService.Navigating, but this method is preferred as then you do not need to remove the event handler from NavigationService to avoid object lifetime issues.
member.param: The event arguments. If Cancel is set to true, it will cancel the pending operation that triggered this method call.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.Page.OnNavigatedFrom(System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called when a Page has been navigated away from, and is no longer the active Page in a Frame. This is a good time to save dirty data or otherwise react to being inactive.
member.remarks: This is similar to signing up for this.NavigationService.Navigated, but this method is preferred as then you do not need to remove the event handler from NavigationService to avoid object lifetime issues.
member.param: The event arguments

member.name: P:System.Windows.Controls.Page.NavigationContext
member.summary: Gets the navigation request context.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Controls.Page.NavigationService
member.summary: Gets the that navigated to this page

member.name: P:System.Windows.Controls.Page.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of this page, which may be shown in the browser window if this page is hosted in a browser-integrated . Leave this property null to indicate it should not affect the title.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Navigation.ContentLoaderBase
member.summary: ContentLoaderBase serves as the base class for all content loaders that plug into NavigationService.
member.remarks: ContentLoaderBase types should always generate and load content asychronously.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.ContentLoaderBase.BeginLoad(System.Uri,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous loading of the provided .
member.param: A URI value to resolve and begin loading.
A callback function that will be called when this asynchronous request is ready to have called on it.
A custom state object that will be returned in , to correlate between multiple async calls.
member.returns: An that can be passed to at any time, or after the has been called.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.ContentLoaderBase.CancelLoad(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Attempts to cancel a pending load operation.
member.param: The returned from for the operation you wish to cancel.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.ContentLoaderBase.EndLoad(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Completes the asynchronous loading of content
member.param: The result returned from , and passed in to the callback function.
member.returns: The content loaded, or null if content was not loaded

member.name: T:System.Windows.Navigation.PageResourceContentLoader
member.summary: Default implementation of IContentLoader that is capable of resolving URI values to XAML types (of IPageControl) located in the application deployment XAP.
member.remarks: The URI values used to indicate XAML IPageControl types should always be relative to the XAP root. Do not generate URI values relative to XAML IPageControl type locations.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.PageResourceContentLoader.GetLocalXaml(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the XAML string of the page at the given path. If that page cannot be found (path does not exist, etc.) then it returns null.
member.param: The path and name of the XAML (with the ".xaml" included)
member.returns: See summary

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.PageResourceContentLoader.BeginLoad(System.Uri,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous loading of the provided .
member.param: A URI value to resolve and begin loading.
A callback function that will be called when this asynchronous request is ready to have called on it.
A custom state object that will be returned in , to correlate between multiple async calls.
member.returns: An that can be passed to at any time, or after the has been called.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.PageResourceContentLoader.CancelLoad(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Attempts to cancel a pending load operation.
member.param: The returned from for the operation you wish to cancel.
member.remarks: Cancellation is not guaranteed. Check the result from EndLoad to determine if cancellation was successful.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.PageResourceContentLoader.EndLoad(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Completes the asynchronous loading of content

member.returns: The content loaded, or null if content was not loaded

member.name: T:System.Windows.Navigation.Journal
member.summary: Journal used to manage a history list of JournalEntry items.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Navigation.Journal._syncLock
member.summary: Synchronization lock object.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Navigation.Journal._suppressNavigationEvent
member.summary: Used to indicate whether or not to suppress navigation events.
member.remarks: This is used internally to avoid redundant browser navigation calls after deep link values are detected.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Navigation.Journal._weakRefEventHandler
member.summary: Internal event handler reference used to sign up to the UriFragmentHelper.Navigated event.
member.remarks: The event handler constructed here will use a weak reference to self in order to allow for this instance to be collected.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.Journal.AddHistoryPoint(System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry)
member.summary: Adds a new JournalEntry to the history stack.
member.param: A new JournalEntry to add to the history stack.
member.remarks: Any JournalEntry items existing on the ForwardStack will be removed.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.Journal.CheckForDeeplinks
member.summary: Forces the BrowserJournal to check for deep-link values in the browser address URI.
member.returns: A boolean indicating whether or not a deep-link value was found.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.Journal.GoBack
member.summary: Navigates the Journal instance back to the previous JournalEntry item in the history stack.
member.remarks: If CanGoBack is false, this method will throw an InvalidOperationException.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.Journal.GoForward
member.summary: Navigates the Journal instance forward to the next JournalEntry item in the history stack.
member.remarks: If CanGoForward is false, this method will throw an InvalidOperationException.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.Journal.NavigateBrowser(System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry)
member.summary: Updates the browser location to reflect the Journal state, if the Journal is browser integrated.
member.param: JournalEntry used to update the browser location.

member.param: Event sender.
Empty event args.

member.param: An updated state value to examine.

member.summary: Signs up for events on UriFragmentHelper.Navigated using a weak-reference based event handler.

member.summary: Indicates that the should walk up the visual tree to determine if it is top-level. If it is top-level, this is the same as . If it is not top-level, this is the same as .

member.summary: Indicates that the should keep its own journal and not integrate with the browser. This option can be set on any

member.name: F:System.Windows.Navigation.JournalOwnership.UsesParentJournal
member.summary: Indicates that the should integrate with the browser journal. If this is not a top-level Frame, this is not valid and an exception will be thrown.

member.summary: Navigating back in history.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.StopLoading
member.summary: StopLoading aborts asynchronous navigations that haven't been processed yet or that are still being downloaded. SopLoading does not abort parsing of the downloaded streams. The NavigationStopped event is fired only if the navigation was aborted.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper
member.summary: Provides navigation services to update the browser URL fragment (hash). For use in creating browser fragment navigation events that will not reload the page DOM.
member.remarks: The hosting Silverlight control must have HTML script access for browser fragment navigation services to work.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.ScriptResourceKey
member.summary: Resource key for embedded browser navigation JavaScript.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.MaxUriLength
member.summary: Maximum allowed length of URLs generated by this server.
member.remarks: There are no standard restrictions on URL length. This is an artificial limitation imposed to ensure cross-browser compatibility.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.clientScriptsReady
member.summary: A boolean used to indicate whether or not client scripts are ready on the page.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.Navigate(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a navigation entry in the host browser using the provided URI fragment.
member.param: A URI fragment to record in the browser history.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.Navigate(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a navigation entry in the host browser using the provided URI fragment and updates the host browser title.
member.param: A URI fragment to record in the browser history.
A title string used to update the browser title text.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.OnNavigated
member.summary: Raises the Navigated event.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.ValidateUrlLengthRestrictions(System.String)
member.summary: Validates that the value will not exceed the safe URI length limit.
member.param: A URI fragment to record in the browser history.
member.returns: A value indicating whether or not the URI fragment value will exceed the safe URI length limit.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.RenderClientScript
member.summary: Retrieves and renders browser history JavaScript from our resource manifest.
member.returns: A value indicating whether or not the required browser history client script was found and rendered on the host page.

member.name: E:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.Navigated
member.summary: Occurs when the browser URL fragment has changed.
member.remarks: The current System.Windows.Application instance will be passed as the event sender.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the UriFragmentHelper can be used.
member.remarks: The hosting Silverlight control must have HTML script access for the UriFragmentHelper to work.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.BrowserNavigationProxy
member.summary: Proxy used internally to communicate with the browser.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.BrowserNavigationProxy.ScriptObjectKey
member.summary: Script object key used in client JavaScript to access the proxy object.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.BrowserNavigationProxy.ScriptMethodKey
member.summary: Script object method key used in client JavaScript to access the proxy object navigation method.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.BrowserNavigationProxy.instance
member.summary: Singleton instance of proxy object.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.BrowserNavigationProxy._sysScriptObject
member.summary: Reference to HTML DOM window.Sys object.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.BrowserNavigationProxy._navigatorScriptObject
member.summary: Reference to HTML DOM window.Sys.Navigator object.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.BrowserNavigationProxy.#ctor
member.summary: Private constructor.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.BrowserNavigationProxy.BrowserNavigated
member.summary: Notifies the UriFragmentHelper of a browser navigation event.
member.remarks: This method is intended to be invoked by client scripts through the HTML bridge.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.BrowserNavigationProxy.Navigate(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Navigates the browser using the provided URI Fragment.
member.param: A URI fragment to place in the browser location URI.
Browser title string.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.BrowserNavigationProxy.RegisterSelf
member.summary: Registers the current application for browser navigation interop.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.BrowserNavigationProxy.Current
member.summary: Gets a reference to singleton BrowserNavigationProxy instance.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.BrowserNavigationProxy.SysScriptObject
member.summary: Gets the HTML page "Sys" script object or returns null if not found.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.UriFragmentHelper.BrowserNavigationProxy.NavigatorScriptObject
member.summary: Gets the HTML page "Sys.Navigator" script object or returns null if not found.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Navigation.UriMapperBase
member.summary: Maps a URI into a new URI based on mapping rules defined in a concrete implementation.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriMapperBase.MapUri(System.Uri)
member.summary: Maps a given URI and returns a mapped URI.
member.param: Original URI value to be mapped to a new URI.
member.returns: A URI derived from the parameter.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Navigation.UriMapper
member.summary: Default IUriMapper implementation that uses a List of UriMapping objects to map and transform URI values.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriMapper.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriMapper.MapUri(System.Uri)
member.summary: Maps a given URI and returns a mapped URI.
member.param: Original URI value to be mapped to a new URI.
member.returns: A URI derived from the parameter.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.UriMapper.UriMappings
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of UriMapping objects.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Navigation.UriMapping
member.summary: Defines a URI to URI mapping.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriMapping.MapUri(System.Uri)
member.summary: Attempts to process a Uri, if it matches the Uri template
member.param: The Uri to map
member.returns: The Uri after mapping, or null if mapping did not succeed

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.UriMapping.Uri
member.summary: Gets or sets the original URI value or pattern.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.UriMapping.MappedUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the mapped URI value or pattern.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriParsingHelper.InternalUriIsFragment(System.Uri)
member.summary: Parses the Uri to determine if it is a fragment
member.param: The uri to parse
member.returns: True if this Uri is a fragment, false if it is not

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriParsingHelper.InternalUriGetFragment(System.Uri)
member.summary: Parses the Uri to retrieve the fragment, if present
member.param: The uri to parse
member.returns: The fragment, or null if there is not one

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriParsingHelper.InternalUriGetAllButFragment(System.Uri)
member.summary: Parses the Uri to strip off the fragment
member.param: The uri to parse
member.returns: The uri without the fragment

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriParsingHelper.InternalUriGetQueryString(System.Uri)
member.summary: Parse the query string out of a Uri (the part following the '?')
member.param: The uri to parse for a query string
member.returns: The query string, without a leading '?'. Empty string in the case of no query string present.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriParsingHelper.InternalUriGetBaseValue(System.Uri)
member.summary: Cut the query string off a given Uri, to process only the part before the '?', and strips off the fragment
member.param: The uri to parse
member.returns: The uri without its query string, and without its fragment

member.name: M:System.Windows.Navigation.UriParsingHelper.InternalUriParseQueryStringToDictionary(System.Uri)
member.summary: Parses the query string into name/value pairs
member.param: The Uri to parse the query string from
member.returns: A dictionary containing one entry for each name/value pair in the query string

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.Resource.NavigationService_UriNotNavigable
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Navigation is only supported to relative Uri's that are fragments, or begin with '/' or which contain ';component/'.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.Resource.PageResourceContentLoader_InvalidComponentSyntax
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Attempted to load local XAML with an invalid syntax. When a ';component/' is present, it must have the assembly name on the left side, and the page path and name on the right..

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.Resource.PageResourceContentLoader_NoXAMLWasFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to No XAML was found at the location '{0}'.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.Resource.PageResourceContentLoader_TheTypeSpecifiedInTheXClassCouldNotBeFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The type '{0}', specified in the x:Class of '{1}' could not be found in any loaded assembly..

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.Resource.PageResourceContentLoader_XAMLWasUnloadable
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to XAML at location '{0}' was unloadable..

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.Resource.UriFragmentHelper_BrowserNavigationProxy_RegistrationFailed
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unable to register BrowserNavigationProxy. Exception: {0}.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.Resource.UriFragmentHelper_HtmlBridgeDisabled
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The UriFragmentHelper is unavailable because the HTML bridge is disabled. Please ensure your Silverlight instance has script access. For more information, see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.browser.htmlpage.isenabled(VS.95).aspx..

member.name: P:System.Windows.Navigation.Resource.UriFragmentHelper_MaximumUriLength
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The UriFragmentHelper is unable to navigate to the Uri fragment provided because doing so would violate the maximum Uri length restriction of 2048 characters..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to UriMapper must not have a null UriMappingCollection..
